intro: Solanum stenorchis, commonly known as the narrow-fruit nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, egg-shaped berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is not recommended for consumption.
